analyzed: khos thar ba mya ngan las 'das pa gtan med pa 'dra snyam nas skur pa btab pas /
translated: They think that there is no way to attain liberation and nirvana.

original: dmyal bar ltung ba yod do //
analyzed: dmyal bar ltung ba yod do //
translated: They deprecate the Dharma and fall into the hells.

original: kha cig blo rno bas 'phar te 'gro ba yang yod /
analyzed: kha cig blo rno bas 'phar te 'gro ba yang yod /
translated: Some of them, because of their sharp minds, escape and go elsewhere.🔽They say that their meditation on concentration was mistaken. Their bodies

original: bsam gtan bsgoms pa nor pa yin zer lus 'od che la dran pa mi rgyu /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgoms pa nor pa yin zer lus 'od che la dran pa mi rgyu /
translated: are very bright, but they are not mindful.

original: mdor na 'du @221b shes med pa'i lha /
analyzed: mdor na 'du @221b shes med pa'i lha /
translated: In brief, the gods of the realm of neither discernment nor nondiscernment

original: gzugs su rags la tshor ba zhan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs su rags la tshor ba zhan pa'o //
translated: have coarse form but weak feelings.

original: mi che ba'i lha rnams zhes bya ba ni /🔽lus tshad ni dpag tshad stong /
analyzed: mi che ba'i lha rnams zhes bya ba ni / lus tshad ni dpag tshad stong /
translated: The gods of the realm of the Great Fruit🔽are one thousand leagues in size.

original: tshe tshad kyang bskal pa bzhi stong ngo //
analyzed: tshe tshad kyang bskal pa bzhi stong ngo //
translated: Their lifespan is four thousand eons.

original: nges tshig ni rtog pa gong ma tsam du mi che'o //
analyzed: nges tshig ni rtog pa gong ma tsam du mi che'o //
translated: The definition is that it is not as great as the previous conception.

original: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /🔽lus tshad kyang dpag tshad nyis stong /
analyzed: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni / lus tshad kyang dpag tshad nyis stong /
translated: The gods of the Heaven of No Hardship🔽are two thousand yojanas in size.

original: tshe tshad kyang bskal pa nyis stong /
analyzed: tshe tshad kyang bskal pa nyis stong /
translated: Their lifespan is two thousand eons.

original: nges tshig ni khams gsum gyi gdung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges tshig ni khams gsum gyi gdung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The definition is that they are free from the hardships of the three realms.

original: gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /🔽lus tshad ni dpag tshad bzhi stong /
analyzed: gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni / lus tshad ni dpag tshad bzhi stong /
translated: The gods of the Heaven of Excellent Vision🔽are four thousand yojanas in size.

original: tshe tshad kyang bskal pa bzhi stong thub po //
analyzed: tshe tshad kyang bskal pa bzhi stong thub po //
translated: Their lifespan is four thousand eons.

original: nges tshig ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa bsgoms pas /
analyzed: nges tshig ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa bsgoms pas /
translated: The definition is that by meditating on the absorptions and the uncontaminated states,

original: 'bras bu bde zhing gya nom pas gya nom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bde zhing gya nom pas gya nom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the result is blissful and excellent, so it is called excellent.

original: shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /🔽lus tshad ni dpag tshad brgyad stong ngo //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni / lus tshad ni dpag tshad brgyad stong ngo //
translated: The gods of the Heaven of Perfect Vision🔽are eight thousand yojanas in size.

original: tshe tshad kyang bskal pa brgyad stong thub po //
analyzed: tshe tshad kyang bskal pa brgyad stong thub po //
translated: Their lifespan is eight thousand eons.

original: nges tshig ni gnas de na thar pa dang / bde ba thob pa ni ma yin /
analyzed: nges tshig ni gnas de na thar pa dang / bde ba thob pa ni ma yin /
translated: The definition is that in that realm, they have not attained liberation and bliss.

original: gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa bgrod pa'i gnas su mthong bas shin tu mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa bgrod pa'i gnas su mthong bas shin tu mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “Very Far Reaching” because it is seen as the place to travel to for the attainment of ultimate nirvana.

original: 'og min gyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /🔽lus tshad ni dpag tshad khri drug stong /
analyzed: 'og min gyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni / lus tshad ni dpag tshad khri drug stong /
translated: The gods of the Highest Heaven🔽are sixteen thousand leagues tall.

original: tshe tshad bskal pa khri drug stong thub po /
analyzed: tshe tshad bskal pa khri drug stong thub po /
translated: Their lifespan is sixteen thousand eons.

original: nges tshig ni gzugs khams bcu bdun gyi bla mar gyur pas /🔽'og min la bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gsal bas /
analyzed: nges tshig ni gzugs khams bcu bdun gyi bla mar gyur pas / 'og min la bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gsal bas /
translated: The definition is that since it is the highest of the seventeen form realms,

original: 'og min gsal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'og min gsal zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “Highest Heaven” because it is clear in terms of concentration and meditative absorption.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The gods of the Sphere of Infinite Space

original: tshe tshad ni mtha'i bskal pa nyi khri thub /
analyzed: tshe tshad ni mtha'i bskal pa nyi khri thub /
translated: have a lifespan of twenty thousand eons.

original: nges tshig ni chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar stong pa yin par shes nas /
analyzed: nges tshig ni chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar stong pa yin par shes nas /
translated: The definition is that once one has understood that all phenomena are empty like space,

original: nam mkha' la yang kun du mtha' yas par bltas nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang kun du mtha' yas par bltas nas /
translated: one looks at space as infinite.

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered into meditative absorption in that way,

original: skye mched nye bar blang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched nye bar blang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: one takes up the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The gods of the base of infinite consciousness

original: tshe tshad ni bskal pa bzhi khri thub /
analyzed: tshe tshad ni bskal pa bzhi khri thub /
translated: have a life span of forty thousand eons.🔽The derivation of the term is as follows.

original: nges tshig ni gzugs khams kyi ting nge 'dzin la bltas nas /
analyzed: nges tshig ni gzugs khams kyi ting nge 'dzin la bltas nas /
translated: Looking at the concentration of the form realm,

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas so snyam pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas so snyam pa ni /
translated: they think, “All phenomena are infinite like space.”

original: rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: This is consciousness.

original: de yang ma zad de /🔽rnam par shes pa de dang @222a * //
analyzed: de yang ma zad de / rnam par shes pa de dang @222a * //
translated: Moreover, it is not exhausted.🔽The discernment

original: 'grogs pa'i 'du shes kyang /
analyzed: 'grogs pa'i 'du shes kyang /
translated: that accompanies that consciousness

original: nam mkha' ltar kun du mtha' yas par brtags nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar kun du mtha' yas par brtags nas /
translated: is imagined to be infinite like space.

original: skye mched nye bar blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched nye bar blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they have appropriated the base.🔽The gods of the base of neither

original: yod min med min skye mched kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod min med min skye mched kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: perception nor nonperception🔽have a life span of eighty thousand eons.🔽The derivation of the term is as follows.

original: tshe tshad bskal ba brgyad khri nges tshig ni 'og ma ltar shes pa bkag nas /
analyzed: tshe tshad bskal ba brgyad khri nges tshig ni 'og ma ltar shes pa bkag nas /
translated: Having blocked the consciousness as in the previous case,

original: rmongs pa ni ma rung ngo snyam nas /🔽'du shes yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa ni ma rung ngo snyam nas / 'du shes yod pa ma yin te /
translated: they think, “Delusion is not good.”🔽Therefore, they do not have perception.

original: shes pa 'gags nas med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa 'gags nas med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not the case that consciousness has ceased and does not exist.

original: 'di ni 'du shes cha phra mo tsam la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes cha phra mo tsam la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is based on a mere subtle aspect of discernment.

original: yod min med min zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod min med min zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called neither existence nor nonexistence because it is based on a subtle aspect of discernment.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The gods of the base of nothingness

original: tshe tshad bskal pa drug khri ste /🔽nges tshig ni 'og ma ltar thos pa thams cad kyang ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa'i 'du shes ni /
analyzed: tshe tshad bskal pa drug khri ste / nges tshig ni 'og ma ltar thos pa thams cad kyang ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa'i 'du shes ni /
translated: have a life span of sixty thousand eons.🔽The etymology of the name is as follows.

original: zug rngu'i skye mched yin par rtogs nas /
analyzed: zug rngu'i skye mched yin par rtogs nas /
translated: Having realized that all sounds heard are consciousnesses that focus on concentration, like space, the discernment of infinite space is a source of pain.

original: 'du shes je phra bkag nas ni /
analyzed: 'du shes je phra bkag nas ni /
translated: Having stopped the subtle discernment,

original: 'du shes cung zad kyang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes cung zad kyang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: because discernment does not move in the slightest, it is called the base of nothingness.

original: skye mched mu bzhi po 'di la spags pa'i lus ni med /
analyzed: skye mched mu bzhi po 'di la spags pa'i lus ni med /
translated: In these four bases, there is no body that is extended.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas dang rnam shes mtha' yas gnyis la skye mched nye bar blangs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams la gzugs cung zad yod do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas dang rnam shes mtha' yas gnyis la skye mched nye bar blangs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams la gzugs cung zad yod do zhes brjod do //
translated: In the base of infinite space and the base of infinite consciousness, it is said that there is a little form in the formless realm because the base is appropriated.

original: de dag thams cad la bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad la bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: All of these have death in the middle.

original: rgyal chen rigs bzhi nas 'og min gyi bar du thams cad kyang rin po che'i gos gon no //🔽nyi zer gyi rdul bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i cha gcig ni /
analyzed: rgyal chen rigs bzhi nas 'og min gyi bar du thams cad kyang rin po che'i gos gon no // nyi zer gyi rdul bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i cha gcig ni /
translated: From the Caturmaharajakas to Akanistha, all wear precious garments.

original: rdul phra rab yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab yin no //
translated: One part of forty-nine sun-ray particles is one anu.

original: rdul phra rab bdun la rdul phra mo gcig yin no //🔽rdul phra mo bdun la nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go //🔽nyi zer gyi rdul bdun la ri bong gi rdul gcig go //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bdun la rdul phra mo gcig yin no // rdul phra mo bdun la nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go // nyi zer gyi rdul bdun la ri bong gi rdul gcig go //
translated: Seven anus is one louse egg.🔽Seven louse eggs is one sun-ray particle.

original: ri bong gi rdul bdun la /🔽lug rdul gcig go //🔽lug rdul bdun la ni glang rdul gcig go //
analyzed: ri bong gi rdul bdun la / lug rdul gcig go // lug rdul bdun la ni glang rdul gcig go //
translated: Seven sun-ray particles is one rabbit particle.🔽Seven rabbit particles is one sheep particle.🔽Seven sheep particles is one cow particle.🔽Seven cow particles is one barley seed.

original: glang rdul bdun la sro ma gcig / sro ma bdun la aa ba ga na gcig / aa ba ga na bdun la ba ti ka gcig / ba ti ka bdun la nas gcig nas bdun la sor gcig / sor nyi shu rtsa gnyis la khru gang /
analyzed: glang rdul bdun la sro ma gcig / sro ma bdun la aa ba ga na gcig / aa ba ga na bdun la ba ti ka gcig / ba ti ka bdun la nas gcig nas bdun la sor gcig / sor nyi shu rtsa gnyis la khru gang /
translated: Seven barley seeds is one finger width.🔽Twenty-four finger widths is one cubit.

original: 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams kha cig ni /
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams kha cig ni /
translated: Some people of Jambudvīpa

original: gos khru tshad 'di lta bu brtsis pa'i khru brgyad ba gon @222b no ;
analyzed: gos khru tshad 'di lta bu brtsis pa'i khru brgyad ba gon @222b no ;
translated: In Jambudvipa, the smallest garment measures eight cubits.

original: / kha cig ni khru bcu pa'o //
analyzed: / kha cig ni khru bcu pa'o //
translated: In Godaniya, it measures ten cubits.

original: lus 'phags po rnams kyi khru nyi shu'o //
analyzed: lus 'phags po rnams kyi khru nyi shu'o //
translated: In Videha, it measures twenty cubits.

original: ba lang spyod rnams kyi ni khru bzhi bcu pa /
analyzed: ba lang spyod rnams kyi ni khru bzhi bcu pa /
translated: In Godaniya, it measures forty cubits.

original: sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi ni dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos khru brgyad cu pa gon no //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi ni dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos khru brgyad cu pa gon no //
translated: In Kuru, the garment is made of celestial cloth, and measures eighty cubits.

original: rgyal chen bzhi nas 'og min gyi bar du ni /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi nas 'og min gyi bar du ni /
translated: From the Caturmaharajakas to Akanistha,

original: lus ci ran pa'i gos gon no //
analyzed: lus ci ran pa'i gos gon no //
translated: the garment covers the body as much as is necessary.

original: 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du pho'i mtshan ma dang mo'i mtshan ma yod do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du pho'i mtshan ma dang mo'i mtshan ma yod do //
translated: From Jambudvipa to Paranirmitavasavartin, there are male and female sexual organs.

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du /
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du /
translated: From Brahmakayika to Akanistha,

original: pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po med do //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po med do //
translated: there are no male or female sexual organs.

original: 'dzam bu gling dang / lus 'phags dang / ba lang spyod gsum nas bag ma gtong ba dang len pa yod do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling dang / lus 'phags dang / ba lang spyod gsum nas bag ma gtong ba dang len pa yod do //
translated: In Jambudvipa, Videha, and Godaniya, there is marriage.

original: sgra mi snyan pa la ni med do //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa la ni med do //
translated: In Kuru, there is no marriage.

original: rgyal chen bzhi nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The four continents, the six desire gods, and the first concentration have both.

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du gtong ba dang len pa gnyis ka med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du gtong ba dang len pa gnyis ka med do //
translated: The gods of the second concentration and above have neither.

original: 'dzam bu gling nas gling gsum la shin tu grang ba dang / cha ba yod do //🔽sgra mi snyan na med do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling nas gling gsum la shin tu grang ba dang / cha ba yod do // sgra mi snyan na med do //
translated: The three continents have both cold and heat.🔽The gods of the desire realm have both.

original: rgyal chen bzhi nas 'og min gyi bar du tsha grang gnyis ka med do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi nas 'og min gyi bar du tsha grang gnyis ka med do //
translated: The gods of the second concentration and above have neither.

original: 'dzam bu gling pa la dgun dang dpyid dang dbyar dang ston yod pa bzhin du gling gsum dang rgyal chen bzhi nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling pa la dgun dang dpyid dang dbyar dang ston yod pa bzhin du gling gsum dang rgyal chen bzhi nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The gods of the desire realm have the four seasons.

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du dus bzhi med do //🔽ji ltar 'dzam bu gling nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed gyi bar du /
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du dus bzhi med do // ji ltar 'dzam bu gling nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed gyi bar du /
translated: The gods of the second concentration and above do not have the four seasons.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo yod do //
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo yod do //
translated: The gods of the desire realm have both day and night.

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du nyin mo dang mtshan mo med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du nyin mo dang mtshan mo med do //
translated: The gods of the second concentration and above do not have day and night.

original: 'dzam bu gling nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du pha ma yod do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du pha ma yod do //
translated: From Jambudvīpa up to Paranirmitavaśavartin, there are fathers and mothers.

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi lha rnams la pha ma med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi lha rnams la pha ma med do //
translated: From Brahmakāyika up to Akaniṣṭha, there are no fathers and mothers.

original: 'dzam bu gling nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la rje dang bran yod do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la rje dang bran yod do //
translated: From Jambudvīpa up to Paranirmitavaśavartin, there are masters and servants.

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du rje dang bran med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du rje dang bran med do //
translated: From Brahmakāyika up to Akaniṣṭha, there are no masters and servants.

original: 'dzam bu gling nas gling gsum na ni /
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling nas gling gsum na ni /
translated: In Jambudvīpa and the three continents,

original: 'bru dang nor yod do //
analyzed: 'bru dang nor yod do //
translated: there are grains and wealth.

original: sgra mi snyan na 'bru ni yod nor ni med do //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan na 'bru ni yod nor ni med do //
translated: In Kuru, there are grains but no wealth.

original: rgyal chen bzhi nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du 'bru ni med nor ni yod do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du 'bru ni med nor ni yod do //
translated: From Caturmahārājakāyika up to Paranirmitavaśavartin, there is no grain but there is wealth.

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du nor yang med 'bru yang med do //🔽'dzam bu gling gi mi rnams la pha ma'am bu mo'am bran bo'am /
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du nor yang med 'bru yang med do // 'dzam bu gling gi mi rnams la pha ma'am bu mo'am bran bo'am /
translated: From Brahmakāyika up to Akaniṣṭha, there is neither grain nor wealth.

original: rje'am 'brul mngon par zhen pa @223a * //🔽yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rje'am 'brul mngon par zhen pa @223a * // yod pa bzhin du /
translated: In Jambudvīpa, there are men who are attached to their fathers, mothers, sons, daughters, servants,🔽masters, grains, and wealth.

original: gling gnyis po la yang yod //
analyzed: gling gnyis po la yang yod //
translated: In the two continents, there is the same.

original: sgra mi snyan pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa rnams la ni /
translated: In Kuru,

original: mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: They do not cling to anything.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams la ni /
translated: The gods of the Four Great Kings

original: 'bru ma gtogs pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'bru ma gtogs pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa yod pa bzhin du /
translated: cling to all things except for grain.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du /
translated: From the Heaven of the Thirty-Three up to the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations,

original: 'bru ma gtogs pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa yod do //
analyzed: 'bru ma gtogs pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa yod do //
translated: they cling to all things except for grain.🔽From the Heaven of Brahmā up to the Highest Heaven,

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du ci la yang zhen pa med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du ci la yang zhen pa med do //
translated: they do not cling to anything.

original: gling bzhi pa'i mi rnams la bud med zla mtshan can dang / sbrum pa dang bu btsa' ba yod do //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i mi rnams la bud med zla mtshan can dang / sbrum pa dang bu btsa' ba yod do //
translated: In the human realms of the four continents, women have their periods, become pregnant, and give birth.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi ni /🔽'dzam bu gling gi mi rnams kyi bu tsha lo lnga lon pa tsam mam /🔽lha'am lha'i bu mo'i phrag pa'am /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi ni / 'dzam bu gling gi mi rnams kyi bu tsha lo lnga lon pa tsam mam / lha'am lha'i bu mo'i phrag pa'am /
translated: The gods of the Four Great Kings

original: pang bar rdzus te skye ba'o //
analyzed: pang bar rdzus te skye ba'o //
translated: are born when a child of five years old is placed on the shoulder or lap of a god or goddess.

original: lha'am lha'i bu mo rnams ni /
analyzed: lha'am lha'i bu mo rnams ni /
translated: The gods and goddesses think,

original: bdag gi bu'am bu mo yin snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bu'am bu mo yin snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: “This is my son or daughter.”

original: khye'u dang bu de dag ni /
analyzed: khye'u dang bu de dag ni /
translated: The boys and girls think,

original: 'di dag ni bdag cag gi pha'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag cag gi pha'o //
translated: “These are our fathers and mothers.”

original: ma'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: ma'o snyam du sems so //
translated: This is what they think.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams ni /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams ni /
translated: The gods of the Thirty-Three

original: lo drug lon pa tsam /
analyzed: lo drug lon pa tsam /
translated: are born there with the size of a child of six years old.

original: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi lo bdun lon ba tsam /
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi lo bdun lon ba tsam /
translated: The Yāma gods are born there with the size of a child of seven years old.

original: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi lo brgyad lon pa tsam /
analyzed: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi lo brgyad lon pa tsam /
translated: The Tuṣita gods are born there with the size of a child of eight years old.

original: 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi lo dgu lon pa tsam /
analyzed: 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi lo dgu lon pa tsam /
translated: The Nirmāṇarati gods are born there with the size of a child of nine years old.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi lo bcu lon pa tsam /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi lo bcu lon pa tsam /
translated: The Paranirmitavaśavartin gods are born there with the size of a child of ten years old.

original: lha'am lha'i bu mo'i phrag pa'am bang bar rdzus te skye'o //
analyzed: lha'am lha'i bu mo'i phrag pa'am bang bar rdzus te skye'o //
translated: They are born there by apparition, on the shoulder or on the lap of a god or a goddess.

original: lha'am lha'i bu mo dga' 'di ni bdag gi lha'i bu mo snyam du sems so //
analyzed: lha'am lha'i bu mo dga' 'di ni bdag gi lha'i bu mo snyam du sems so //
translated: The god or the goddess thinks: “This is my son or my daughter.”

original: khye'u dang bu mo de dag kyang bdag cag gi pha'am ma snyam du sems so //
analyzed: khye'u dang bu mo de dag kyang bdag cag gi pha'am ma snyam du sems so //
translated: The son or the daughter thinks: “This is my father or this is my mother.”

original: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du /
analyzed: tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du /
translated: From the Brahmakāyika gods up to the Akaniṣṭha gods,

original: thog ma nas lus kyi yan lag dang / nyid lag thams cad rdzogs par skye zhing /
analyzed: thog ma nas lus kyi yan lag dang / nyid lag thams cad rdzogs par skye zhing /
translated: they are born there with all their limbs and organs, complete in size as adults.

original: 'chi ba na yang de kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba na yang de kho na bzhin no //
translated: When they die, it is the same.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la ni lus med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la ni lus med do //
translated: In the formless realms, there is no body.

original: de bas de dag la skye ba yang mi mngon /
analyzed: de bas de dag la skye ba yang mi mngon /
translated: Therefore, birth there is not evident.

original: 'chi ba yang mi mngon no //
analyzed: 'chi ba yang mi mngon no //
translated: Death is also not evident.

original: rdzu 'phrul che ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are called “greatly miraculous” because

original: lha de rnams ni rang gi sa nas steng du 'gro mi nus par /
analyzed: lha de rnams ni rang gi sa nas steng du 'gro mi nus par /
translated: those gods are unable to go up from their own level.

original: de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, they are also bases of miraculous powers.

original: 'od dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'od dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are called “luminous” because

original: 'od de yang yar mi 'gro zhing rang rang khyab nas 'od du gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'od de yang yar mi 'gro zhing rang rang khyab nas 'od du gsal ba'o //
translated: that light does not go up and illuminates as light that pervades each one.

original: bsod nams che zhing longs spyod che ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod nams che zhing longs spyod che ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are called “great merit and great enjoyment” because

original: lha de rnams kyi rang rang gi bsod nams kyi longs spyod che chung dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lha de rnams kyi rang rang gi bsod nams kyi longs spyod che chung dang ldan pa'o //
translated: those gods have great merit and great enjoyment.

original: dbang che zhing 'khor mang po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang che zhing 'khor mang po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are called “great power and great retinue” because

original: @223b lha de rnams kyang bsod nams kyi dbang gis 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: @223b lha de rnams kyang bsod nams kyi dbang gis 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: those gods have a perfect retinue by the power of their merit.

original: de bzhin du dbang che ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang che ba'o //
translated: In the same way, they have great power.

original: lha dang lha ma yin rnams gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin rnams gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are the abode of gods and demigods.

original: lha ma yin ni zhe sdang dang / ser sna'i dbang gis lha ma yin du grags te /
analyzed: lha ma yin ni zhe sdang dang / ser sna'i dbang gis lha ma yin du grags te /
translated: Demigods are known as demigods because of the power of their hatred and stinginess.

original: de med pa ni lha yin no //
analyzed: de med pa ni lha yin no //
translated: The absence of that is the god.

original: de bzhin du yon tan dang ldan pa'i lha dang lha ma yin rnams gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan dang ldan pa'i lha dang lha ma yin rnams gnas pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the gods and asuras who possess good qualities dwell there.

original: de rnams kyis kyang rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis bdag la srung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis bdag la srung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: They too should protect me with this queen of incantations, the great Uṣṇīṣavijayā.

original: thugs rje che zhing 'jig rten gyi khams la khyab pa /
analyzed: thugs rje che zhing 'jig rten gyi khams la khyab pa /
translated: The one who is greatly compassionate and pervades the world

original: ma lus par rdzogs pa'i sems can gyi don la srung ba dang skyob par byed do //
analyzed: ma lus par rdzogs pa'i sems can gyi don la srung ba dang skyob par byed do //
translated: protects and saves all sentient beings without exception.

original: de lta bu'i rig sngags kyi rgyal mo gang zag gang gis kyang gus shing rjes su yi rang nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rig sngags kyi rgyal mo gang zag gang gis kyang gus shing rjes su yi rang nas /
translated: Any person who respectfully rejoices in such a queen of incantations

original: lha de rnams kyis srung ba dang skyob par byed par 'gyur te tshe phyi ma la yang srung ba'o //
analyzed: lha de rnams kyis srung ba dang skyob par byed par 'gyur te tshe phyi ma la yang srung ba'o //
translated: will be protected and saved by those gods, and will be protected in future lives as well.

original: sba ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sba ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: As for concealed and so forth,

original: sngar gor du bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gor du bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood as explained above.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo las lha rnams bshad pa'i gnas skabs te bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo las lha rnams bshad pa'i gnas skabs te bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the nineteenth chapter, on the explanation of the gods, in the “Great Peacock Queen of Knowledge” tantra.

original: // / kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Ānanda,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thugs rje can rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thugs rje can rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: it was taught by the compassionate, perfectly awakened buddhas.

original: drang srong snying rje chen po rnams kyi ming srung shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: drang srong snying rje chen po rnams kyi ming srung shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Protect the names of the great compassionate ṛṣis” means

original: brtul zhugs kyi dbang gis drang srong nyi ma'i lta ba dang / tshangs pa'i lta ba dang gnyis yod de /
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi dbang gis drang srong nyi ma'i lta ba dang / tshangs pa'i lta ba dang gnyis yod de /
translated: there are two ṛṣis, the ṛṣi of the view of the sun and the ṛṣi of the view of Brahmā, due to their vows.

original: drang srong chad par lta ba ni nyi ma'i gzhung ngo //
analyzed: drang srong chad par lta ba ni nyi ma'i gzhung ngo //
translated: The ṛṣi of the view of annihilation is the text of the sun.

original: drang srong rtag par lta ba ni tshangs pa'i gzhung ngo //
analyzed: drang srong rtag par lta ba ni tshangs pa'i gzhung ngo //
translated: The ṛṣi of the view of permanence is the text of Brahmā.

original: de gnyis rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i drang srong rnams kyi ming zung shig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i drang srong rnams kyi ming zung shig ces bya'o //
translated: “Protect the names of the ṛṣis of the views of permanence and annihilation” means

original: brtul zhugs grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtul zhugs grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “accomplisher of vows.”

original: de gnyis kyang dga' thub kyi dbang gis /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang dga' thub kyi dbang gis /
translated: Due to their vows,

original: rang gi lus la tshangs par spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang gis dka' thub byas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus la tshangs par spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang gis dka' thub byas pa'o //
translated: He practiced asceticism by himself, with the nature of pure conduct.

original: rig sngags grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rig sngags grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having mastered the knowledge mantras” means

original: rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyis phyi'i rig pa grub pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyis phyi'i rig pa grub pa ste /
translated: having mastered the external knowledge mantras with his own knowledge wisdom.

original: phyi'i rig pa de ni mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i rig pa de ni mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: That external knowledge is the superknowledges.

original: grags pa 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grags pa 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having blazing fame” means

original: drang srong de rnams la 'jig rten gyi khams la grags pa'o //
analyzed: drang srong de rnams la 'jig rten gyi khams la grags pa'o //
translated: that those sages had fame in the world.

original: yang na 'bar ba ni /
analyzed: yang na 'bar ba ni /
translated: Alternatively, “blazing” means

original: de'i dmod mos bsregs pa bzhin du thal bar gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dmod mos bsregs pa bzhin du thal bar gtong ba'o //
translated: that they were like being burned by his curse, and were reduced to ashes.

original: klung dang ri la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: klung dang ri la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Dwelling in rivers and mountains” means

original: mi'i sems can rnams la mi gnas pa'i sa'am /🔽'bras @224a * //
analyzed: mi'i sems can rnams la mi gnas pa'i sa'am / 'bras @224a * //
translated: that they did not dwell on the earth of human beings.🔽They ate

original: bu rtsa ba shing gi skogs pa gon pa'o //
analyzed: bu rtsa ba shing gi skogs pa gon pa'o //
translated: fruits, roots, and bark garments.

original: sha med pa keng rus 'jigs pa'i cha byad can /
analyzed: sha med pa keng rus 'jigs pa'i cha byad can /
translated: They were without flesh, with the appearance of a terrifying skeleton,

original: skra ring ba sen mo ring ba phreng ba dang ril ba spyi blugs thogs pa'o //
analyzed: skra ring ba sen mo ring ba phreng ba dang ril ba spyi blugs thogs pa'o //
translated: with long hair, long nails, and holding rosaries and water pots.

original: smod pa'i mtshon cha can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smod pa'i mtshon cha can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having the weapon of contempt” means🔽that they had the weapon of contempt for the world.

original: rang mgu ba'i dus su legs par smras na /
analyzed: rang mgu ba'i dus su legs par smras na /
translated: When he speaks well at the right time,

original: bzang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzang bar 'gyur te /
translated: he becomes good.

original: ngan par smras pas ngan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan par smras pas ngan par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he speaks badly, he becomes bad.

original: dka' thub drag ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dka' thub drag ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “severe asceticism,”

original: sems can gzhan ma bzhin du srog gcod par mi byed la /
analyzed: sems can gzhan ma bzhin du srog gcod par mi byed la /
translated: he does not kill other living beings,

original: ma byin par mi lan par /
analyzed: ma byin par mi lan par /
translated: he does not take what is not given,

original: 'dod pa log par mi g-yem zhing /
analyzed: 'dod pa log par mi g-yem zhing /
translated: he does not engage in sexual misconduct,

original: mi tshangs par mi spyod pa /🔽brdzun du mi smra zhing /
analyzed: mi tshangs par mi spyod pa / brdzun du mi smra zhing /
translated: he does not engage in sexual activity,🔽he does not tell lies,

original: phra ma dang ngag 'khyal med de /
analyzed: phra ma dang ngag 'khyal med de /
translated: he does not engage in slander or idle talk,

original: tshig rtsub mo yod do //
analyzed: tshig rtsub mo yod do //
translated: but he does use harsh speech.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “having magical powers,”

original: lha dang mi dang klu dang gsum dus gcig tu rgyu nus ba'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang klu dang gsum dus gcig tu rgyu nus ba'o //
translated: he is able to travel simultaneously to the realms of gods, humans, and nāgas.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “having the five superknowledges,”

original: lus kyi mngon par shes pa /
analyzed: lus kyi mngon par shes pa /
translated: there is the superknowledge of the body,

original: ngag gi mngon par shes pa /
analyzed: ngag gi mngon par shes pa /
translated: the superknowledge of speech,

original: yid kyi mngon pa shes pa /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon pa shes pa /
translated: the superknowledge of the mind,

original: mig gi mngon par shes pa /
analyzed: mig gi mngon par shes pa /
translated: the superknowledge of the eyes,

original: rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: and the superknowledge of the ears.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba de dag gi ming brjod kyis khyod zung shig ces bya ba ni ngang ba'i rgyal po gser lta bu bzhin du nam mkha' la rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba de dag gi ming brjod kyis khyod zung shig ces bya ba ni ngang ba'i rgyal po gser lta bu bzhin du nam mkha' la rgyu ba'o //
translated: This is like the golden goose king who moves through the sky.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for such as,

original: drang srong rnams la lta ba'o //
analyzed: drang srong rnams la lta ba'o //
translated: it is the view of the sages.

original: drang srong chen po brgyad pa zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po g-yon phyogs pa zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen bo g-yon phyogs lha zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po lha skyabs kyi bu zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'od zer can zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: drang srong chen po brgyad pa zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po g-yon phyogs pa zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen bo g-yon phyogs lha zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po lha skyabs kyi bu zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'od zer can zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The eight great sages, the great sage on the left, the great sage god on the left, the great sage god son of refuge, the great sage Marici, and the great sage Kapila.

original: lnga po de rnams kyang rdzu 'phrul che ba gzi brjid dang ldan te /
analyzed: lnga po de rnams kyang rdzu 'phrul che ba gzi brjid dang ldan te /
translated: These five have great miraculous powers and splendor.

original: bsam gtan bzhi la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi la gnas pa'o //
translated: They abide in the four dhyanas.

original: de rnams sku mdog dang / phyag mtshan ni /
analyzed: de rnams sku mdog dang / phyag mtshan ni /
translated: As for their colors and hand implements,

original: dkar po dang / sngo skya dang / dkar ser dang / sngon po dang / ser po'o //
analyzed: dkar po dang / sngo skya dang / dkar ser dang / sngon po dang / ser po'o //
translated: they are white, pale blue, white-yellow, blue, and yellow.

original: g-yas rnams na dbyu gu gsum pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yas rnams na dbyu gu gsum pa bsnams pa /
translated: The right hands hold a triple stick.

original: g-yon rnams na phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon rnams na phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
translated: The left hands hold a rosary.

original: de rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi bka' las mi 'da' zhing /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi bka' las mi 'da' zhing /
translated: They do not transgress the word of the Buddha,

original: rig sngags rjes su dren pa'o ;
analyzed: rig sngags rjes su dren pa'o ;
translated: and they remember the knowledge-mantra.

original: / drang srong chen po kun gyi bshes zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po gnas nas 'jog ces bya ba dang / drang srong chen po grog mkhar ba zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'dro ba skyong gi bu zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: / drang srong chen po kun gyi bshes zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po gnas nas 'jog ces bya ba dang / drang srong chen po grog mkhar ba zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'dro ba skyong gi bu zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The great sage called Sarvārthasiddha, the great sage called Vasiṣṭha, the great sage called Vālmīki, the great sage called Āraḍa Kālāma,

original: drang srong chen po 'dro ba skyong gi bu rgan po zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: drang srong chen po 'dro ba skyong gi bu rgan po zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the great sage called Udraka Rāmaputra.

original: @224b drang srong da rnams ni bstan bcos la mkhas pa /
analyzed: @224b drang srong da rnams ni bstan bcos la mkhas pa /
translated: These sages are experts in the treatises,

original: gzugs tshad la mkhas pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs tshad la mkhas pa lnga'o //
translated: and experts in the measure of form.

original: de rnams kyi kha dog dang phyag mtshan ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi kha dog dang phyag mtshan ni /
translated: Their colors and implements are:

original: dmar skya dang / nag po dang / sngo bsangs dang / ljang gu dang / ser po'o //
analyzed: dmar skya dang / nag po dang / sngo bsangs dang / ljang gu dang / ser po'o //
translated: pale red, black, dark blue, green, and yellow.

original: g-yas rnams na pu ste /
analyzed: g-yas rnams na pu ste /
translated: The right hands hold a stick.

original: g-yon rnams na phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon rnams na phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
translated: The ones on the left hold rosaries.

original: lnga po de rnams kyis kyang rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar /
analyzed: lnga po de rnams kyis kyang rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar /
translated: These five great sages do not transgress the words of the vidyā-mantra,

original: srung ba dang skyob par byed do //
analyzed: srung ba dang skyob par byed do //
translated: and they protect and guard.

original: drang srong chen po ngan spong zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po ngan spong dga' zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'gro 'dzin zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'gro dga' zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'jigs can zhes bya ba dang lnga po de dag kyang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: drang srong chen po ngan spong zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po ngan spong dga' zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'gro 'dzin zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'gro dga' zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po 'jigs can zhes bya ba dang lnga po de dag kyang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang /
translated: The five great sages named Aṅgaja, Aṅgīrasa, Ṛṣi, Ṛṣivaktra, and Bhayaṃkara, they too are absorbed in the meditative absorption of cessation,

original: rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du byed rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du byed rnams spong ba'o //
translated: and they abandon consciousness, feeling, and formations.

original: drang srong de rnams ni tshangs pa'i gzhung gis rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: drang srong de rnams ni tshangs pa'i gzhung gis rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: These sages, by the authority of Brahmā, have the view of permanence.

original: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /
translated: Their colors and implements are as follows:

original: ser po dang / dmar po dang / nag po dang / thal ba'i mdog dang / sngon po'o //
analyzed: ser po dang / dmar po dang / nag po dang / thal ba'i mdog dang / sngon po'o //
translated: and blue.

original: g-yas g-yon gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: They are in the mudra of the two hands folded in front.

original: de rnams kyis kyang rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar srung ba dang skyob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar srung ba dang skyob par byed pa'o //

original: drang srong chen po skal ldan shing rta zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po rgyun shes kyi bu zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po mdun du bdar zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po mgo bo che zhes bya ba dang drang srong chen po gshin rje'i me zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: drang srong chen po skal ldan shing rta zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po rgyun shes kyi bu zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po mdun du bdar zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po mgo bo che zhes bya ba dang drang srong chen po gshin rje'i me zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the great sage named Yama-agni,

original: rig byed kyi gzhung gis rig byed gtso bor byas nas rtag par smra ba dang / rig byed bzhi ni mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan dngags kyi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / nyams yod kyi rig byed dang /
analyzed: rig byed kyi gzhung gis rig byed gtso bor byas nas rtag par smra ba dang / rig byed bzhi ni mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan dngags kyi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / nyams yod kyi rig byed dang /
translated: The four Vedas are the Veda of sacrifice, the Veda of poetry, the Veda of healing, and the Veda of magic.

original: de bzhi yang bkra shis shing tshe ring ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhi yang bkra shis shing tshe ring ba'o //
translated: Those four are auspicious and long-lived.

original: nad med pa dmod mos 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nad med pa dmod mos 'dod pa'o //

original: de'i sgo nas grol bar 'dod pa'i lta bas so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas grol bar 'dod pa'i lta bas so //

original: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /

original: dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / sngon po dang / nag po'o //
analyzed: dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ser po dang / sngon po dang / nag po'o //

analyzed: g-yas rnams na bum pa spyi blugs 'dzin cing g-yon rnams na dbyu gu gsum pa bsnoms pa'o //
translated: They hold a water pot and a ritual ladle in their right hands and a triple stick in their left hands.

analyzed: drang srong de rnams kyis kyang rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar srung ba dang skyob par byed pa @225a * //

original: pa'o // drang srong chen po gnyis 'thung gi bu zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po gnyis 'thung nag po'i bu zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po ljang sngo'i bu zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po ljang sngo'i tsha bo zhes bya ba dang /

analyzed: drang srong chen po dag mnyam zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /

original: nyi ma'i gzhung gis chad par lta ba ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i gzhung gis chad par lta ba ste /

analyzed: rgya mtsho'i 'gram nas rkang pa g-yas pa yar blangs shing /

analyzed: g-yon pa sa la btsugs nas nyi ma la lta ba'o //

original: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /
translated: Their colors and hand implements are

analyzed: phyag gnyis thal mo sbyar nas gnam la blta ba'o //

analyzed: drang srong chen po de rnams kyis kyang srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: Those great sages also protect, guard, and do not transgress the words of the vidya-mantra.

original: drang srong chen po 'phags po zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po yang dag 'phags po zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po bzod pa smra zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po grags pa zhes bya ba dan /

analyzed: drang srong chen po rab grags zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /

original: tshangs pa'i gzhung gis rtag par lta ba ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gzhung gis rtag par lta ba ste /

analyzed: bum pa'i rang bzhin 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //

original: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /
translated: Their colors and hand implements are as follows:

analyzed: nag po dang / dmar skya dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'o //

analyzed: phyag gnyis bum pa spyi blugs bsnams pa'o //

original: rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar /

original: srung ba dan skyob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba dan skyob par byed pa'o //

original: drang srong chen po bla ma zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po grub pa zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po gru 'dzin zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po rta bu zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po gang can zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /

translated: the great sage called Guru, the great sage called Siddha, the great sage called Boat Holder, the great sage called Son of Horse, and the great sage called Possessor of Hair.

analyzed: 'gog pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //

analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /

analyzed: phyag gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //

analyzed: drang srong chen po rgyags pa zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de rnams kyang chad par lta ba ste /

original: chos thams cad 'chal par rtogs nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'chal par rtogs nas /

analyzed: ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'o //

original: de rnams kyi sku mdog dan phyag mtshan ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog dan phyag mtshan ni /
translated: Their colors and hand implements are

analyzed: dkar po dang / dmar po dang / ser po dang / nag po dang / thal ba'i mdog go //

analyzed: drang srong de rnams ni rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar /

original: drang srong chen po gza' lhag ces bya ba dang / drangs rong chen po dug sel zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen pos 'dzin zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po rva gcig pa zhes bya ba dang / drang srong chen po drang srong rva zhe bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: bum pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis lus bems por 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang rig sngags kyi bka' las mi 'da' bar rjes su yi rang zhing srung ba dang skyob par byed pa'o //

analyzed: drang srong bdun po de dag ni /

analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /

analyzed: dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / ljang nag dang / dmar skya'o //

analyzed: g-yas rnams na phreng ba dang / dbyu gu gsum bsnams shing /

analyzed: g-yon rnams na ril ba spyi blugs bsnams pa'o //

analyzed: drang srong de rnams kyang rig sngags rjes su dran zhing /

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o ;

original: / kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis yang nas yang du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: / kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis yang nas yang du gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: drang srong chen po rnying pa 'di dag ni /

analyzed: rig byed rnams byed pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de rnams ni sngon gyi drang srong chen po ste /

analyzed: de rnams kyang rig byed bzhi 'don zhing /

original: rig byed de rnams kyi don ni /
analyzed: rig byed de rnams kyi don ni /

analyzed: gsang sngags rnams byed ba zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzhan sems can rnams la skyob bar byed pa'o//

translated: The so-called cursing is that their curses are effective.

original: brtul zhugs grub pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtul zhugs grub pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dge slong bzhin du 'dod chags dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / de rnams spangs la bsgom pa la gtso bor byas pa'o //

original: gzi brjid che ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzi brjid che ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called great splendor is

analyzed: bum pa gang ba dang / sems bems por grub nas /

analyzed: de rnams kyi gzi brjid kyis gnon pa'o //

original: grub pa dag ste zhes bya ste /
analyzed: grub pa dag ste zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang thun mong gi dngos grub thob pa'o //

analyzed: de dag gis kyang rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis bdag la bsrung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /

original: rig sngags 'di ni zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
analyzed: rig sngags 'di ni zhal gsum phyag drug pa /

analyzed: 'jig rten nas bla na med pa gnas pa ste /

analyzed: mi dang byol song rnams kyi skye ba'i las 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: g-yon rnams na las kyi ri mo'i me long bsnams pa'o //

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o //

analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po de rnams kyangs  'og na gnas pa'i yi dgas dmyal ba'i las kyi me long 'dzin ba'o //

original: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni /

analyzed: g-yas rnams na be con dang / lcags kyu dang / dbyug to dang / zhags pa'o //

analyzed: g-yon rnams na las kyi me long gi ri mo bsnams pa'o //
translated: In their left hands they hold a mirror with the designs of karma.

original: sa 'og la dbang mdzad cing /
analyzed: sa 'og la dbang mdzad cing /

analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo'i bka' las mi 'da' bar sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //

original: kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: blta bar bya'o //

original: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags ni //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gsang sngags ni //
translated: The mantra of the vidyā is

translated: It pervades the world

original: sems can rnams la 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: and terrifies sentient beings.

original: tadya th'a zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tadya th'a zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Tadyathā means

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “thus.”

original: 'jig rten gyi dug gsum lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dug gsum lta ba'o //
translated: It is the view of the three worldly poisons.

original: aanda r'a zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: aanda r'a zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Andrā means

original: sgo nga las byung ba'i dug yin te /
analyzed: sgo nga las byung ba'i dug yin te /
translated: the poison of the egg-born,

original: sbrul la sogs pa'i sems can las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa'i sems can las byung ba'o //
translated: which comes from such beings as snakes.

original: kha rlangs kyi dug dang / mche ba'i dug go //
analyzed: kha rlangs kyi dug dang / mche ba'i dug go //
translated: It is the poison of breath and the poison of the fangs.

original: pa nda r'a ni klu'i dug bsam pa'i dug go //
analyzed: pa nda r'a ni klu'i dug bsam pa'i dug go //
translated: Panadarā is the poison of the nāgas, the poison of thought.

original: mthong ba dang gnyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba dang gnyis so //
translated: It is the poison of sight and the poison of touch.

original: k'a ra ta ni klu'i dug reg pa'i dug go //
analyzed: k'a ra ta ni klu'i dug reg pa'i dug go //
translated: Karatā is the poison of the nāgas, the poison of contact.

original: 'dzin pa'i dug go //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i dug go //
translated: It is the poison of grasping.

original: ke y'u r'a ni bum ba'i dug yin te /
analyzed: ke y'u r'a ni bum ba'i dug yin te /
translated: Keyūrā is the poison of the vase,

original: de ni reg pa'i dug go //
analyzed: de ni reg pa'i dug go //
translated: which is the poison of touch.

original: bh'u tangga m'a ni 'byung po rnams kyi mthong ba'i dug yin te /
analyzed: bh'u tangga m'a ni 'byung po rnams kyi mthong ba'i dug yin te /
translated: Bhūtaṅgamā is the poison of sight of the bhūtas.

original: de yang dug bzhi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dug bzhi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is also the abode of the four poisons.

original: bh'u tapa ti ni mi ma yin gyi dug yin te /
analyzed: bh'u tapa ti ni mi ma yin gyi dug yin te /
translated: Bhūtapati is the poison of the nonhuman,

original: de yang mthong ba dang / reg pa dang / bsam pa las byung ba'i dug yin te /
analyzed: de yang mthong ba dang / reg pa dang / bsam pa las byung ba'i dug yin te /
translated: which is the poison of sight, touch, and thought.

original: bindu pa ti ni thigs pa'i dug yin te /
analyzed: bindu pa ti ni thigs pa'i dug yin te /
translated: Bindupati is a poison of the drops.

original: de yang bsam pa dang mthong ba las byung ba /
analyzed: de yang bsam pa dang mthong ba las byung ba /
translated: It arises from thought and sight.

original: klu'i dug phol mig go //
analyzed: klu'i dug phol mig go //
translated: It is a poison of the nagas.

original: si ri pa ti ni de yang klu'i dug yin te /
analyzed: si ri pa ti ni de yang klu'i dug yin te /
translated: Siri-pati is also a poison of the nagas.

original: dmu chu'i nang do //🔽te jo ba ti ni klu'i dug me dbal gyi nad yin no //
analyzed: dmu chu'i nang do // te jo ba ti ni klu'i dug me dbal gyi nad yin no //
translated: It is in the urine.🔽Tejovati is a poison of the nagas.🔽It is a disease of the skin.

original: ya sho ba ti ni de yang klu'i nad yin te /
analyzed: ya sho ba ti ni de yang klu'i nad yin te /
translated: Yaso-grapati is a poison of the nagas.

original: mdze'i bye brag go //
analyzed: mdze'i bye brag go //
translated: It is a particular kind of leprosy.

original: ya sho grap ti ni sa bdag gi dug yin te /
analyzed: ya sho grap ti ni sa bdag gi dug yin te /
translated: Yaso-grapati is a poison of the lords of the earth.

original: 'bras kyi nad do //
analyzed: 'bras kyi nad do //
translated: It is a disease of the stomach.

original: aa ra d'a ni sa bdag gi rigs g-ya' ba'o //
analyzed: aa ra d'a ni sa bdag gi rigs g-ya' ba'o //
translated: Ardana is a poison of the lords of the earth.🔽It is a disease of the skin.

original: ta ra d'a ni sa bdag gi rigs @228b sha bkra'i nad do //
analyzed: ta ra d'a ni sa bdag gi rigs @228b sha bkra'i nad do //
translated: Tarada is a disease of the skin.

original: ta ra da ni 'brum bu'o //
analyzed: ta ra da ni 'brum bu'o //
translated: Tarada is smallpox.

original: tu tu r'a ni lhog pa'i nad do //
analyzed: tu tu r'a ni lhog pa'i nad do //
translated: Tudurā is a disease of the lymph.🔽Danta-hara is a poison of the teeth and so forth.

original: danta ha r'a ni mche ba la sogs pa las byung ba sems can dug gi so'i dug go //
analyzed: danta ha r'a ni mche ba la sogs pa las byung ba sems can dug gi so'i dug go //
translated: It is a poison of sentient beings.

original: ha la ha la ni 'jig rten drag bo'i dug yin te /
analyzed: ha la ha la ni 'jig rten drag bo'i dug yin te /
translated: Halahala is a poison of the world.

original: sems can nang gi dug go //
analyzed: sems can nang gi dug go //
translated: It is an inner poison of sentient beings.

original: me l'a ha la gra ni sbyor ba'i dug go //
analyzed: me l'a ha la gra ni sbyor ba'i dug go //
translated: Melāhagra is a poison of combination.

original: p'a la ni 'bras bu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: p'a la ni 'bras bu las byung ba'o //
translated: Palani is the fruit.

original: gu ha ni gsang ba'i dug go //
analyzed: gu ha ni gsang ba'i dug go //
translated: Guha is the secret poison.

original: gsang ba'i dug ni dam tshig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dug ni dam tshig las byung ba'o //
translated: The secret poison is born from the pledge.

original: tsa r'i ni brtan pa ste mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tsa r'i ni brtan pa ste mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Carani is firm, unchanging.

original: dandu r'a ni btsan dug go //
analyzed: dandu r'a ni btsan dug go //
translated: Dandura is the poison of the powerful.

original: ai ri ki tsi k'a ni rtsa ba'i dug go //
analyzed: ai ri ki tsi k'a ni rtsa ba'i dug go //
translated: Irikikaca is the root poison.

original: kamb'a ni blta ba'i dug go //
analyzed: kamb'a ni blta ba'i dug go //
translated: Kamva is the poison of the look.

original: sha ta dandu r'a ni log ba'i dug go //
analyzed: sha ta dandu r'a ni log ba'i dug go //
translated: Sata-dandura is the poison of the perverse.

original: bi pu le ni sprin gyi dug go //
analyzed: bi pu le ni sprin gyi dug go //
translated: Vipula is the poison of the clouds.

original: na ku le ni sre mong las byung ba'o //
analyzed: na ku le ni sre mong las byung ba'o //
translated: Nakula is born from the mongoose.

original: kir'i pi ni phyi ba'i dug go //
analyzed: kir'i pi ni phyi ba'i dug go //
translated: Kiripi is the poison of the owl.

original: ta rangg'a rishta ni srin bu ki ti'i dug go //
analyzed: ta rangg'a rishta ni srin bu ki ti'i dug go //
translated: Tarangaristha is the poison of the kitia insect.

original: aa mra ma ti ni sbrul nag po'i dug go //
analyzed: aa mra ma ti ni sbrul nag po'i dug go //
translated: Amra-mati is the poison of the black snake.

original: dz'amb'u ma ti ni sha dug go //
analyzed: dz'amb'u ma ti ni sha dug go //
translated: Jambumati is the flesh poison.

original: ma dhu ma ti ni bdud rtsi las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma dhu ma ti ni bdud rtsi las byung ba'o //
translated: Madhumati is born from nectar.

original: ka ma le ni mthong ba'i dug go //
analyzed: ka ma le ni mthong ba'i dug go //
translated: Kamala is the poison of the look.

original: bi ma le ni phye ma'i dug go //
analyzed: bi ma le ni phye ma'i dug go //
translated: Vimala is the poison of the powder.

original: kunda le ni rtsa ba'i dug go //
analyzed: kunda le ni rtsa ba'i dug go //
translated: Kundali is the root poison.

original: aa ha du hi ni sdig pa mang po'i dug go //
analyzed: aa ha du hi ni sdig pa mang po'i dug go //
translated: Ahadhuhi is the poison of many sins.

original: aa di na di ni sdig pa dmar po'i dug go //
analyzed: aa di na di ni sdig pa dmar po'i dug go //
translated: “Adi nadi” is the poison of red sin.

original: 'bu ge 'bu ge ni sa dug go //
analyzed: 'bu ge 'bu ge ni sa dug go //
translated: “ Gege gege” is the poison of the earth.

original: bad sa n'a bhe ni spre'u de ba'i dug go //🔽ma h'a ga re ni nag po brtsegs pa'i dug go //
analyzed: bad sa n'a bhe ni spre'u de ba'i dug go // ma h'a ga re ni nag po brtsegs pa'i dug go //
translated: “ Vasabha” is the poison of the monkey.🔽“ Mahāgara” is the poison of Kālaka.

original: du lambe ni rtsa ba nag po'i dug go //🔽su lam be ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du lambe ni rtsa ba nag po'i dug go // su lam be ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Dulamba” is the poison of the black root.

original: rin po che'i dbyig dug go //
analyzed: rin po che'i dbyig dug go //
translated: “ Sulambha” is the poison of the precious jewel.

original: sv'a h'a ni dug bcom pa'o //🔽kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sv'a h'a ni dug bcom pa'o // kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Svāhā” is the destruction of poison.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: “ Ānanda” is the words of the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: 'di dag ni dug chen po dag ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dug chen po dag ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ These are the great poisons”

original: 'jig rten la grags ba'i phyi'i dug ces ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags ba'i phyi'i dug ces ba'o //
translated: refers to the worldly poisons.

original: de dag gis kyang rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis bdag la srung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis bdag la srung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “ May they protect me through this queen of incantations, the great peahen”

original: phyi'i dug dang / nang gi dug 'joms nus pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dug dang / nang gi dug 'joms nus pa'o //
translated: refers to the ability to destroy both external and internal poisons.

original: rigs pa'i rang bzhin rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di la gang zag gang gis kyang gus par byas na /
analyzed: rigs pa'i rang bzhin rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di la gang zag gang gis kyang gus par byas na /
translated: Whoever respectfully recites this queen of knowledge mantras, the nature of reasoning,

original: dug nad thams cad kyis mi tshugs shing /
analyzed: dug nad thams cad kyis mi tshugs shing /
translated: will not be harmed by any poison.

original: dug nad de rnams kyis kyang srung ba dang skyob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dug nad de rnams kyis kyang srung ba dang skyob par byed pa'o //
translated: And those poisons will protect and guard them.

original: sba ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sba ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To conceal”

original: dug nad thams cad las sba ba'o //
analyzed: dug nad thams cad las sba ba'o //
translated: means to conceal from all poisons.

original: yongs su bskyab pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su bskyab pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To protect”

original: dug de rnams las bskyab pa'o //
analyzed: dug de rnams las bskyab pa'o //
translated: means to protect from those poisons.

original: yongs su gzung ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To hold”

original: nad de'i 'jigs pa las @229a * //
analyzed: nad de'i 'jigs pa las @229a * //
translated: means to hold from the fear of those illnesses.

original: gzung ba'o // yongs su bskyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzung ba'o // yongs su bskyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To nurture”

original: de'i 'jigs pa las thar ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'jigs pa las thar ba'o //
translated: means to liberate from the fear of those illnesses.

original: zhi ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhi ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To pacify”

original: dug nad de dag thams cad zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dug nad de dag thams cad zhi ba'o //
translated: means to pacify all those poisonous illnesses.

original: bde legs su 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde legs su 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To bring well-being”

original: dug nad bcom nas bde ba'o //
analyzed: dug nad bcom nas bde ba'o //
translated: means to be well after conquering the poisons.

original: chad ba spang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chad ba spang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To abandon punishment”

original: dug can rnams kyi chad pa spang ba'o //
analyzed: dug can rnams kyi chad pa spang ba'o //
translated: means to abandon punishment for those with poisons.

original: mtshon cha spang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshon cha spang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Abandoning weapons” means

original: de'i mthong ba'i dug gi mtshon cha spangs ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mthong ba'i dug gi mtshon cha spangs ba'o //
translated: abandoning the weapons of the poison of views.

original: dug gzhil ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dug gzhil ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Neutralizing poison” means

original: dug 'ong ba rnams spang ba'o //
analyzed: dug 'ong ba rnams spang ba'o //
translated: abandoning the poison of coming.

original: dug gsod pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dug gsod pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Killing poison” means

original: yod pa yang med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa yang med par byed pa'o //
translated: making what exists nonexistent.

original: lo brgya 'tsho bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lo brgya 'tsho bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “May you live a hundred years” means

original: nad des mi tshugs shing tshe ring pa'o //
analyzed: nad des mi tshugs shing tshe ring pa'o //
translated: not being harmed by that illness and having a long life.

original: ston brgya mthong bar shog shig ces bya ba ni /🔽phun sum tshogs shing /
analyzed: ston brgya mthong bar shog shig ces bya ba ni / phun sum tshogs shing /
translated: “May you see a hundred autumns” means🔽having perfect

original: nad rnams dang bral ba'o //🔽rag sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo las /
analyzed: nad rnams dang bral ba'o // rag sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo las /
translated: and being free from illness.

original: dug gi ming bstan pa'i gnas skabs te nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: dug gi ming bstan pa'i gnas skabs te nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the names of poisons, the twenty-second in the glorious Caṇḍa­mahā­roṣaṇa tantra called “The Sole Hero.”

original: // / kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Ānanda,”

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: the perfect, complete Buddha said.

original: khyod kyis shing ljon pa chen po rnams kyi ming zung shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis shing ljon pa chen po rnams kyi ming zung shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “You should remember the names of the great trees.”

original: byang chub kyi shing ljon pa chen po 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing ljon pa chen po 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas pa'o //
translated: The great Bodhi tree is located in Jambudvīpa.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Thus” means

original: byang chub kyi shing rnams blta ba'o //🔽shing ljon pa chen po gser zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po ser skya zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon ba chen po khya ba gnas zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po sbre'u gnas zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po padma dkar po zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing rnams blta ba'o // shing ljon pa chen po gser zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po ser skya zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon ba chen po khya ba gnas zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po sbre'u gnas zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po padma dkar po zhes bya ba dang /
translated: to see the Bodhi trees.🔽The great tree called Suvarṇa, the great tree called Kapila, the great tree called Kṣīravṛkṣa, the great tree called Śālmali, the great tree called Pundarīka,

original: shing ljon po chen po ser po zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po mya ngan 'tshang zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po rna ldan byed ces bya ba ni shing ljon pa de yang rim pa bzhin du /
analyzed: shing ljon po chen po ser po zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po mya ngan 'tshang zhes bya ba dang / shing ljon pa chen po rna ldan byed ces bya ba ni shing ljon pa de yang rim pa bzhin du /
translated: the great tree called Pīlu, the great tree called Aśoka, and the great tree called Śikhi—these trees are, in order,

original: shar dang shar lho dang lho nub dang / nub dang nub byang dang / byang dang byang shar dang / de bzhin du zhing skyong la yang rim pa bzhin du shar nas bskor te /
analyzed: shar dang shar lho dang lho nub dang / nub dang nub byang dang / byang dang byang shar dang / de bzhin du zhing skyong la yang rim pa bzhin du shar nas bskor te /
translated: In the east, southeast, southwest, west, northwest, north, northeast, and likewise, in the directions of the field protectors, beginning in the east, they are, in order:

original: glang po che'i gdong can dang / ra'i gdong can dang / ma he'i gdong can dang / yi dags kyi gdong can dang / chu srin gyi gdong can dang / sha ba'i gdong can dang / rta'i gdong can dang / glang gi gdong can no //
analyzed: glang po che'i gdong can dang / ra'i gdong can dang / ma he'i gdong can dang / yi dags kyi gdong can dang / chu srin gyi gdong can dang / sha ba'i gdong can dang / rta'i gdong can dang / glang gi gdong can no //
translated: the elephant-faced one, the goat-faced one, the buffalo-faced one, the ghost-faced one, the crocodile-faced one, the deer-faced one, the horse-faced one, and the ox-faced one.

original: g-yas rnams na rdo rje dang / rtse gcig dang / be con dang / ral @229b gri dang / sbrul zhags dang / ba dan dang / bum pa dang / rtse gsum mo /
analyzed: g-yas rnams na rdo rje dang / rtse gcig dang / be con dang / ral @229b gri dang / sbrul zhags dang / ba dan dang / bum pa dang / rtse gsum mo /
translated: In their right hands they hold a vajra, a single-pronged vajra, a club, a sword, a snake noose, a banner, a vase, and a trident.

original: g-yon rnams ni sdigs mdzub dang zhags pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon rnams ni sdigs mdzub dang zhags pa'o //
translated: In their left hands they make a threatening gesture and hold a lasso.
